column2: WEST VIRGINIA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: West Virginia

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column6: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: low clearance.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 3. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
4. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column4: after changing lanes.
column8: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 5. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column6: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.

column2: 6. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 7. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 10. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 11. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: red warning lights.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column10: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 13. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column10: pass other vehicles and then stop.

column2: 14. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on an open county highway is:
column4: 65 MPH

column2: 15. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the lane you’re in.
column10: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 16. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 17. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column8: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 18. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle

column2: 19. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 20. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: flash your brake lights.

column2: 21. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column10: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 22. The picture shows:
column4: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 23. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 24. On an undivided highway, when approaching a school bus with its lights flashing drivers must:
column4: proceed with caution.

column2: 25. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: stop immediately.
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light
